title: [IOTDB-3232] Implement read interface for WAL
body:
1. wal file name change from _{version}.wal to _{version}-{startIndex}.wal
2. provide two node allocation strategy, standalone mode uses RoundRobinStrategy, cluste mode uses FirstCreateStrategy
3. search log by index
4. blocking/non-blocking iterator

title: Fix time iterator bug
body: hasNext() method in iterator should not move iterator to next postition.

title: [IOTDB-3253] Upgrade dependency: Ratis from 2.2.0 to 2.3.0
body:
Recently Apache Ratis Community releases 2.3.0, which includes bugfix to known InstallSnapshot issues.
In this PR, I upgrade Ratis version to 2.3.0.

Notice:
  Currently, we name the snapshotDir with Term_Index so that we can tell which directory contains
  the latest snapshot files. Unfortunately, when leader install snapshot to a slow follower,
  current Ratis implementation will flatten the directory and place all the snapshots directly
  under statemachine dir. Under this scenario, we cannot restore Term_Index from directory name.
  We decided to add an empty metadata file containing only Term_Index into the snapshotDir. his
  metadata file will be installed along with application snapshot files, so that Term_Index
  information is kept during InstallSnapshot.

title: Distribution plan for Aggregation Query
body:
## Description
Complete the distribution plan logic for aggregation query. Including:
* SeriesAggregationNode
* AlignedSeriesAggregationNode
* GroupByLevelNode

This PR also contains some changes from @liuminghui233 . He added a new class `GroupByLevelDescriptor` which is extended from `AggregationDescriptor` to make the GroupByLevelNode more clear.

Bump gson from 2.8.5 to 2.8.9 in /library-udf
body:
Bumps [gson](https://github.com/google/gson) from 2.8.5 to 2.8.9.
Release notes

Sourced from gson's releases.

Gson 2.8.9

  • Make OSGi bundle's dependency on sun.misc optional (#1993).
  • Deprecate Gson.excluder() exposing internal Excluder class (#1986).
  • Prevent Java deserialization of internal classes (#1991).
  • Improve number strategy implementation (#1987).
  • Fix LongSerializationPolicy null handling being inconsistent with Gson (#1990).
  • Support arbitrary Number implementation for Object and Number deserialization (#1290).
  • Bump proguard-maven-plugin from 2.4.0 to 2.5.1 (#1980).
  • Don't exclude static local classes (#1969).
  • Fix RuntimeTypeAdapterFactory depending on internal Streams class (#1959).
  • Improve Maven build (#1964).
  • Make dependency on java.sql optional (#1707).

Gson 2.8.8

  • Fixed issue with recursive types (#1390).
  • Better behaviour with Java 9+ and Unsafe if there is a security manager (#1712).
  • EnumTypeAdapter now works better when ProGuard has obfuscated enum fields (#1495).
Changelog

Sourced from gson's changelog.

Version 2.8.9

  • Make OSGi bundle's dependency on sun.misc optional (#1993).
  • Deprecate Gson.excluder() exposing internal Excluder class (#1986).
  • Prevent Java deserialization of internal classes (#1991).
  • Improve number strategy implementation (#1987).
  • Fix LongSerializationPolicy null handling being inconsistent with Gson (#1990).
  • Support arbitrary Number implementation for Object and Number deserialization (#1290).
  • Bump proguard-maven-plugin from 2.4.0 to 2.5.1 (#1980).
  • Don't exclude static local classes (#1969).
  • Fix RuntimeTypeAdapterFactory depending on internal Streams class (#1959).
  • Improve Maven build (#1964).
  • Make dependency on java.sql optional (#1707).

Version 2.8.8

  • Fixed issue with recursive types (#1390).
  • Better behaviour with Java 9+ and Unsafe if there is a security manager (#1712).
  • EnumTypeAdapter now works better when ProGuard has obfuscated enum fields (#1495).

Version 2.8.7

  • Fixed ISO8601UtilsTest failing on systems with UTC+X.
  • Improved javadoc for JsonStreamParser.
  • Updated proguard.cfg (#1693).
  • Fixed IllegalStateException in JsonTreeWriter (#1592).
  • Added JsonArray.isEmpty() (#1640).
  • Added new test cases (#1638).
  • Fixed OSGi metadata generation to work on JavaSE < 9 (#1603).

Version 2.8.6

2019-10-04 GitHub Diff

  • Added static methods JsonParser.parseString and JsonParser.parseReader and deprecated instance method JsonParser.parse
  • Java 9 module-info support
Commits
  • 6a368d8 [maven-release-plugin] prepare release gson-parent-2.8.9
  • ba96d53 Fix missing bounds checks for JsonTreeReader.getPath() (#2001)
  • ca1df7f #1981: Optional OSGi bundle's dependency on sun.misc package (#1993)
  • c54caf3 Deprecate Gson.excluder() exposing internal Excluder class (#1986)
  • e6fae59 Prevent Java deserialization of internal classes (#1991)
  • bda2e3d Improve number strategy implementation (#1987)
  • cd748df Fix LongSerializationPolicy null handling being inconsistent with Gson (#1990)
  • fe30b85 Support arbitrary Number implementation for Object and Number deserialization...
  • 1cc1627 Fix incorrect feature request template label (#1982)
  • 7b9a283 Bump bnd-maven-plugin from 5.3.0 to 6.0.0 (#1985)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.google.code.gson:gson&package-manager=maven&previous-version=2.8.5&new-version=2.8.9)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/network/alerts).

title: [IOTDB-3216]Refactor Segments in SchemaFile to B+ Tree structure from list structure
body:
## Background
Children of the same node on MTree will be stored into one or several linked segments in SchemaFile when Main Memory wears out after #4732 merged . These segments are linked like a list, which turned out poor performance when number of children surged.
## What's Different
This PR reshape the structure between segments which share parent node on MTree to a B+ Tree (both with name and alias), which should improve the performace even with tremendous number of children on one node.

Besides, this PR puts foward a primary framework  named ```PageManager``` which decouples ```SchemaPage``` management from ```SchemaFile``` and makes it more reasonable to implement different structure between ```SchemaPage```s.

And the structure this PR implemented is a bit different from a classical B+ Tree in 2 ways: 

1. A node on this structure may split into 2 part with different number of entries, which is up to the trend of the insertion;
2. The split may take a bulk way if the key of the newly insert is the biggest or smallest of the original node, which may help to improve a little.

![SchemaFileClassDiagram drawio (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22140148/174266311-e48b51e7-d479-43f0-bc1e-ac67921bed2d.png)

A detailed specification for diagram above: https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnJHlbakm1n3GN6uLU6rz8Zm

title: Ignore antlr tokens generated after compile in gitignore
[IOTDB-3246]TsFile Validation Tool
body:
**This tool can be used to check the correctness of tsfile and point out errors in specific timeseries or devices. The types of errors include the following:**
Device overlap between files
Timeseries overlap between files
Timeseries overlap between chunks
Timeseries overlap between pages
Timeseries overlap within one page

See docs in https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnMEahfencKFr6Uat2Mpwevf?from=from_copylink

title: [IOTDB-3236] register a timeseries with a wrong compress type
Add internal port compare when dispatching locally
body:
## Description
Before this change, we only compare the target IP with localhost IP to judge whether to dispatch the fragment instance locally. But it will lead unexpected behaviors when several DataNodes run in the same Host with different Port.

We add the InternalPort compare as another condition to fix this issue.

title: [IOTDB-3109]Fix wrong sender IP shown in receiver
body:
Problem:
  Wrong IP of sender is shown on the receiver.
Solution:
  Java will get IP from /etc/hosts, which can be modified by user. To obtain correct IP of sender, I add if statement in TransportHandler to judge the InetAddress.getLocalHost() is loopback address or not. If the IP address is loopback address, it will establish a UDP socket to receiver to get the correct IP.
Reference:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2381316/java-inetaddress-getlocalhost-returns-127-0-0-1-how-to-get-real-ip
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9481865/getting-the-ip-address-of-the-current-machine-using-java

title: [IOTDB-3225] TsFile Repair Tool
body: Create a repair tool to move corrupted seq files into unseq dir.

title: Modify the serialize/deserialize of MTreeAboveSG with stream & Add storageGroupNode to the result of MNodeAboveSGCollector
body:
## Description


### Modify the serialize/deserialize of MTreeAboveSG with stream
Bytebuffer doesn't support capacity dynamic extension and will occupy more memory resource.

Use BufferedOutputStream and BufferedInputStream to implement serialize and deserialize of MTreeAboveSG separately.

### Add storageGroupNode to the result of MNodeAboveSGCollector
If a storageGroupNode matches the given node query and it doesn't have any schemaPartition, it will be missed since it has not been put to result set while traverse the MTreeAboveSG and there's no related schemaRegion to traverse.

Try add node to result set before storage group check.

title: remove dataOutputStream
body: Remove dataOutputStream and dataInputStream and use ReadWriteIOUtils instead.

title: [IOTDB-3196] Add search index in InsertNode
body: Add search index in InsertNode

title: [IOTDB-3213] Apply visitor pattern for DataRegionStateMachine
body:
See [IOTDB-3213](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3213).
Visitor pattern is used to process plan node in SchemaRegionStateMachine and DistributedPlanner, this issue aims to apply visitor pattern to DataRegionStateMachine.

Attachments

title: [IOTDB-3083] DataNode AuthorInfo cache
body:
DataNode AuthorInfo cache
When the user logs in, the system will check whether there is cache information in the datanode. If not, go to confignode for verification. If the verification is successful, bring the permission information back to the datanode for caching.
After the user logs in successfully, the read and write operations need permission verification. The system will check whether there is cache information on the datanode. If not, go to confignode for verification. If the verification is successful, bring the permission information back to the datanode for caching. Then continue to read and write.


DataNodeAuthorizerManagerTest.java
Added the test of permission cacheThis user has cache
1have permissionwithout role
2no permissionwithout role
3no permissionrole has permissions
4no permissionRole has no permissions


DataNode-ConfigNodeAdded the test of permission cache
1no permissionwithout role
      IoTDB> create user root2 'root2'
      Msg: 602: No permissions for this operation CREATE_USER

2have permissionwithout role
      IoTDB> create user root2 'root2'
      Msg: The statement is executed successfully.

3no permissionrole has permissions
      IoTDB> create role role2
      Msg: The statement is executed successfully.

4no permissionRole has no permissions
      IoTDB> show storage group
      Msg: 602: No permissions for this operation SHOW

title: Fix confignode script error
Add distribution plan logic for AlignedSeriesScan
body: ## Description Add corresponding logic for AlignedSeriesScan in DistributionPlanner

title: [IOTDB-3202] Add cpu load and memory load into heartbeat.
body: See more details: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3202

title: [IOTDB-3188] Multi leader consensus algorithm implementation
body:
The PR does three things:

- Split dataRegion and schemaRegion consensus algorithms so that datanodes can support multiple consensus algorithms.

- Enhance datanode fault-tolerant logic using the consensus layer

- Refer to the [documentation](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnlViYbEffgyh3YVq2aqIW9u) to introduce the MultiLeaderConsensus implementation currently available for dataRegion only

title: [IOTDB-3222] Implementation of AlignedSeriesAggregateScanOperator
[To rel/0.13][IOTDB-3219] fix stop-server on windows
[IOTDB-3219] fix stop-server on windows
body: On windows, stop-server.bat not work

title: Avoild using symlink when pack all-in-one package
[IOTDB-3205] [IOTDB-3208] Align by device query & aggregate query support nested expressions and UDFs
body: After this PR, align by device query & aggregate query support nested expressions and UDFs :-)

title: Fix a file opening conflict bug
body:
- `ConfigNodeInfo.storeConfigNode()` and `IoTDBStartCheck.serializeDataNodeId()` will both update the file system.properties, we forget to close fileInputStream and cause "file has opened" problem.
- Update the properties in memory when updating system.properties

title: [IOTDB-3210]fix npe
body:
## Description

### Problem
see IOTDB-3210

### Cause
When shutDown the system, the metadata component will be cleared, during which some attributes and variables will be set to null to release resource. If there's insertion during system shutdown, it may encounter a cleared metadata module and trigger auto create schema, and this is why there's npe.

### Solution
The metadata clear in shutDownHook is aimed to shut down rocksdb when using rocksdb schema engine mode. Thus add the check before execution.

### Future work
Add some client connection and request execution control, and Polish the elegant system exit/shutdown process.

title: [IOTDB-3196] Add wal read interface for consensus group
body:
1. Add ConsensusReqReader in consensus module
2. Serialize via IConsensusRequest#serializeRequest
3. Deserialize via PlanNodeType#deserialize

title: [IOTDB-3214] Refact predefined metrics in metric framework.
body:
1. Add interface `IMetricSet`
2. Move file, process and system metric into predefined metrics.
3. Remove the difference between dropwizard and micrometer when use jvm predefined metric.

title: Add more note for iotdb upgrade to 0.12
BugFix: Delete snapshotDir on failure
body: RatisConsensus is supposed to delete the snapshotDir on statemachine failure

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-3160] TsFile will be corrupted when flushing memtable appears OOM
body: Corrupted TsFile doesn't recover when exceptions occurs in the flushing memtable procedure, because we only interrupt and do nothing else. To fix this problem, I drop the memTable and skip ending tsfile when meeting flush error.

title: [IOTDB-3024] Implement SchemaRegion Memory mode snapshot
body:
## Description

Implement snapshot feature for SchemaRegion Memory mode to speed up schemaRegion consensus group recovery

title: [IOTDB-2977] Take and load snapshot for DataRegionStateMachine
body:
See [IOTDB-2977](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2977).
This PR add snapshot for DataRegionStateMachine, so that it can delete raft log in time and recover from snapshot directly.

title: [IOTDB-3201] Support RowDataQuery API for new cluster
body:
## Description

Support the following API for MPP new cluster.

```java
    List<String> paths = new ArrayList<>();
    paths.add(ROOT_SG1_D1_S1);
    paths.add(ROOT_SG1_D1_S2);
    paths.add(ROOT_SG1_D1_S3);
    long startTime = 10L;
    long endTime = 200L;

    try (SessionDataSet dataSet = session.executeRawDataQuery(paths, startTime, endTime)) {

      System.out.println(dataSet.getColumnNames());
      dataSet.setFetchSize(1024);
      while (dataSet.hasNext()) {
        System.out.println(dataSet.next());
      }
    }
```

 - Behavioral aspects. What configuration values are acceptable? How are corner cases and error 
    conditions handled, such as when there are insufficient resources?

    design patterns)
 - Method organization and design (how the logic is split between methods, parameters and return types)
 - Naming (class, method, API, configuration, HTTP endpoint, names of emitted metrics)
-->


Finally, let's check the region's location. Please focus on the last log:
```
2022-05-16 20:49:02,576 [TAsyncClientManager#SelectorThread 36] INFO  o.a.i.c.c.h.CreateRegionHandler:69 - Successfully create DataRegion(3) on DataNode: TDataNodeLocation(dataNodeId:3, externalEndPoint:TEndPoint(ip:127.0.0.1, port:6670), internalEndPoint:TEndPoint(ip:127.0.0.1, port:9006), dataBlockManagerEndPoint:TEndPoint(ip:127.0.0.1, port:8780), consensusEndPoint:TEndPoint(ip:127.0.0.1, port:40013))
```

Because we use the weighted random policy, the newest DataNode will get a DataRegion as soon as it's been registered.

title: [MPP][Bug hotfix] Support expressions in select and filter causes
body:
Bugfix list:

[reused TypeProvider in converting Expression->Transformer stage](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/279f96667d85240f0d16df4e9be92bf9e5c7da9d)
 
[bind transformer input column with operator column input index](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/5a3e4512f48a28cc6ededb13933ff6aa5b30cdf4)
 
[fix FilterOperator#iterateFilterReaderToNextValid()](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/53b4c0f0e3b5a39688495a4e938bf5a1fa4c4b2a)
 
[invoke declarePositions(rowCount) in Operator#next()](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/6b3fabfd29d1711d6c77617b6ba2171e88d72bc3)

[invoke readyForFirstIteration() in hasNext() instead of in constructor](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/7e47110c8d6a151e2c411faf507c81e3a48c5fca)

[infer types in server/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/mpp/plan/anal](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/21ffbb8dd37acb91834bcf95fe91eda9b350264b) 
 
[bind input types](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/666ee799e867848c507023ee59f47f9c4505c9d9)
 
[fix outputPointReaders construction](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/commit/e4f52ad0b55d8be9f8e8b1e80827f14972af2019)

title: [IOTDB-3179] Printing logs when get/getOrCreate Partition in ConfigNode
body: Currently, we don't know what PartitionTable that ConfigNode returns to DataNode, which is not conducive to development debug. So I have temporarily added logs for getSchemaPartition getOrCreateSchemaPartition getDataPartition, getOrCreateDataPartition  interfaces.

- Adapt for the new cluster of MPP.
- Add the log record for every node in the cluster integration test.
- Parallel to do cluster integration test.

title: [To rel/0.13][IOTDB-3045] Deleted timeseries are created again after restart
body: Deleted timeseries are created again after restart because auto create timeseries is enabled when wal checks the timeseries schema. To fix this problem, I disable auto create timeseries and enable partial insert when recovering.

title: [IOTDB-3045] Deleted timeseries are created again after restart
body: Deleted timeseries are created again after restart because auto create timeseries is enabled when wal checks the timeseries schema. To fix this problem, I disable auto create timeseries and enable partial insert when recovering.

title: [IOTDB-3040] Fix TTL cannot delete the expired tsfile
body:
See [IOTDB-3040](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/IOTDB/issues/IOTDB-3040)
The reason for this bug is that, the tsfile is set to `DELETED` after it is selected by the `CompactionSelector` and before it is submitted to `CompactionTaskManager`. When `CompactionTaskManager` tries to set its status to `CompactionCandidate`, a exception will be thrown and it will fail. But the exception is caught and not thrown to the `CompactionTaskManager`, which leads to that a task should be cancel is executed. The task accquires the read lock for each tsfile, and does not release them. TTL needs the write lock to delete files, so it cannot work under this situation.

title: [IOTDB-3091] Scripts of stop datanodes
[IOTDB-3160] TsFile will be corrupted when flushing memtable appears OOM
body: Corrupted TsFile doesn't recover when exceptions occurs in the flushing memtable procedure, because we only interrupt and do nothing else. To fix this problem, I drop the memTable and skip ending tsfile when meeting flush error.

title: [IOTDB-3158][metric] fix NPE exception.
body: The problem: See more details: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3158

title: [IoTDB-3170] Add MemoryTable framework for MPP
body:
## Description
Some query only need the information of analyzation, that is, after the analyze() step, the result of this query is got and the following MPP step could be skipped.

Currently we call the intermediate result produced by analysis as MemoryTable. 

This PR is used to implement the framework in MPP.

See this doc to see the detailed usage guide. https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnWnRJQmCWqscG0sO3V4BMnd#Mxr8Jr
